abstract.t: This document describes how Locator/Identifier Separation Protocol (LISP) re-encapsulating tunnels can be used for Traffic Engineering purposes. The mechanisms described in this document require no LISP protocol changes and specify how existing RLOC encodings are used to construct Explicit Locator Paths for traffic engineering purposes. The Traffic Engineering features provided by these LISP mechanisms can span intra-domain, inter-domain, or a combination of both.
